meanings.definition: A mechanical device that allows continuous linear or rotary motion in only one direction.
meanings.sent1: The ratch helped the machine move smoothly in one direction.
meanings.sent2: I fixed the ratch on the conveyor belt to ensure it moved correctly.
meanings.sent3: The little robot tried to ride the ratch like a tiny rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a ratch, steadily pushing her forward.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ratch clicking became a comforting rhythm in the workshop.

meanings.definition: To move or cause to move by increments.
meanings.sent1: I had to ratch the lever slowly to raise the platform.
meanings.sent2: He used a wrench to ratch the bolt into place.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to ratch the acorn up the tree with tiny steps.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to ratch forward as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: She had to ratch up her courage before speaking in front of the class.

meanings.definition: A pawl, click, or detent for holding or propelling a ratchet wheel.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the worn-out ratch in the engine.
meanings.sent2: The ratch clicked into place, securing the gear in position.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the ratch, making it click repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a ratch, stopping her from making a hasty decision.
meanings.sent5: The old clock's ratch was so worn that it no longer held the wheel in place.
